flounder.sounds

Class SoundLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.sounds.SoundLoader

  • public class SoundLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods used for loading and deleting sounds, and also keeps track of all the sound buffers that are currently loaded so that it can delete them when the game closes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SoundLoader() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static void deleteBuffer(java.lang.Integer bufferID)
      Removes a certain sound buffer from memory by removing from the list of buffers and deleting it.
      static void dispose()
      Deletes all the sound buffers that are currently in memory.
      protected static void doInitialSoundLoad(Sound sound)
      Generates an OpenAL buffer and loads some, if not all, of the sound data into it.
      protected static int generateBuffer()
      Generates an empty sound buffer.
      protected static void loadSoundDataIntoBuffer(int bufferID, java.nio.ByteBuffer data, int format, int sampleRate)
      Loads audio data of a certain format into an OpenAL buffer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundLoader

        public SoundLoader()

    • Method Detail

      • doInitialSoundLoad

        protected static void doInitialSoundLoad(Sound sound)
        Generates an OpenAL buffer and loads some, if not all, of the sound data into it. The buffer and other information about the audio data gets set in the sound object. This is called to load a new sound for the first time.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to be loaded.

      • loadSoundDataIntoBuffer

        protected static void loadSoundDataIntoBuffer(int bufferID,
                                              java.nio.ByteBuffer data,
                                              int format,
                                              int sampleRate)
        Loads audio data of a certain format into an OpenAL buffer.
        Parameters:
        bufferID - The buffer to which the data should be loaded.
        data - The audio data.
        format - The OpenAL format of the data (mono, stereo, etc.)
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the audio.

      • generateBuffer

        protected static int generateBuffer()
        Generates an empty sound buffer.
        Returns:
        The ID of the buffer.

      • deleteBuffer

        protected static void deleteBuffer(java.lang.Integer bufferID)
        Removes a certain sound buffer from memory by removing from the list of buffers and deleting it.
        Parameters:
        bufferID - The ID of the buffer to be deleted.

      • dispose

        public static void dispose()
        Deletes all the sound buffers that are currently in memory. Should be called when the application closes.
